definitions.definition: A strong wind.
definitions.example: We're having a bit of a blow this afternoon.

definitions.definition: A chance to catch one’s breath.
definitions.example: The players were able to get a blow during the last timeout.

definitions.definition: Cocaine.
Cannabis.
(US Chicago Regional) Heroin.
To produce an air current.
To propel by an air current.
definitions.example: Blow the dust off that book and open it up.

definitions.definition: To be propelled by an air current.
definitions.example: The leaves blow through the streets in the fall.

definitions.definition: To create or shape by blowing; as in to blow bubbles, to blow glass.
To force a current of air upon with the mouth, or by other means.
definitions.example: to blow the fire

definitions.definition: To clear of contents by forcing air through.
definitions.example: to blow an egg

definitions.definition: To cause to make sound by blowing, as a musical instrument.
To make a sound as the result of being blown.
definitions.example: In the harbor, the ships' horns blew.

definitions.definition: (of a cetacean) To exhale visibly through the spout the seawater which it has taken in while feeding.
definitions.example: There she blows! (i.e. "I see a whale spouting!")

definitions.definition: To explode.
definitions.example: Get away from that burning gas tank! It's about to blow!

definitions.definition: (with "up" or with prep phrase headed by "to") To cause to explode, shatter, or be utterly destroyed.
definitions.example: The aerosol can was blown to bits.

definitions.definition: To cause sudden destruction of.
definitions.example: He blew the tires and the engine.

definitions.definition: To suddenly fail destructively.
definitions.example: He tried to sprint, but his ligaments blew and he was barely able to walk to the finish line.

definitions.definition: (used to express displeasure or frustration) Damn.
To be very undesirable. (See also suck.)
definitions.example: This blows!

definitions.definition: To recklessly squander.
definitions.example: I blew $35 thou on a car.

definitions.definition: To fellate; to perform oral sex on (usually a man)
definitions.example: Who did you have to blow to get those backstage passes?

definitions.definition: To leave, especially suddenly or in a hurry.
definitions.example: Let's blow this joint.

definitions.definition: To make flyblown, to defile, especially with fly eggs.
To spread by report; to publish; to disclose.
To inflate, as with pride; to puff up.
To breathe hard or quick; to pant; to puff.
To put out of breath; to cause to blow from fatigue.
definitions.example: to blow a horse

definitions.definition: To talk loudly; to boast; to storm.
To sing.
definitions.example: That girl has a wonderful voice; just listen to her blow!

definitions.definition: To leave the Church of Scientology in an unauthorized manner.
Blue.
The act of striking or hitting.
definitions.example: A fabricator is used to direct a sharp blow to the surface of the stone.

definitions.definition: A sudden or forcible act or effort; an assault.
A damaging occurrence.
definitions.example: A further blow to the group came in 1917 when Thomson died while canoeing in Algonquin Park.

definitions.definition: A mass or display of flowers; a yield.
A display of anything brilliant or bright.
A bloom, state of flowering.
definitions.example: Roses in full blow.

definitions.definition: To blossom; to cause to bloom or blossom.
